com.eiko.back.connect

Class Connector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eiko.back.connect.Connector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TutorDBConnector

    public class Connector
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles interactions with a database. Instead of using prepared statements it passes all arguments as a Strings to the database.
    Version:
    20151203
    Author:
    Melinda Robertson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connector(java.lang.String driver, java.lang.String host, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Creates a new Connector object that gives access to the indicated database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connector

        public Connector(java.lang.String driver,
                 java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password)
        Creates a new Connector object that gives access to the indicated database.
        Parameters:
        driver - is the driver to use, usually com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
        host - is the host and database name.
        username - is the current user.
        password - is the password corresponding to the user.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String stmt)
        Adds a pre-built query to a stored list.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the query.
        stmt - is the statement to store.

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String name)
        Removes one of the queries from the list.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the query.

      • query

        public java.sql.ResultSet query(java.lang.String query,
                                java.lang.String... param)
        Executes the requested SELECT query. Any other type of query will throw an error.
        Parameters:
        query - is the name of the query to execute.
        param - are the parameters.
        Returns:
        the result of the query.

      • query

        public java.sql.ResultSet query(java.lang.String query)
        Executes a SELECT query.
        Parameters:
        query - is the query to execute.
        Returns:
        the result of the query.

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String query,
                   java.lang.String... param)
        Executes a record change in the database. Must be one of UPDATE, INSERT or DELETE. Any other type of query will throw an error.
        Parameters:
        query - is the name of the query to execute.
        param - are the parameters.

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String query)
        Executes an update. Must be one of UPDATE, INSERT, or DELETE.
        Parameters:
        query - is the update query to execute.
